tag.name: cfschedule
tag.help: Provides a programmatic interface to the CFML scheduling engine. Can run a CFML page at scheduled intervals, with the option to write the page output to a static HTML page. This feature enables you to schedule pages that publish data, such as reports, without waiting while a database transaction is performed to populate the page.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: delete: deletes the specified task update: updates an existing task or creates a new task, if one with the name specified by the task attribute does not exist run: executes the specified task

parameter.name: task
parameter.help: Name of the task.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.help: Operation that the scheduler performs. Must be HTTPRequest.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Name of the file in which to store the published output of the scheuled task

parameter.name: path
parameter.help: Path to the directory in which to put the published file.

parameter.name: startdate
parameter.help: Date on which to first run the scheuled task.

parameter.name: starttime
parameter.help: Time at which to run the scheduled of task starts.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.help: URL of the page to execute.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Port to use on the server that is specified by the url parameter. If resolveURL = "yes", retrieved document URLs that specify a port number are automatically resolved, to preserve links in the retrieved document. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value.

parameter.name: publish
parameter.help: Yes: save the result to a file No: does not

parameter.name: enddate
parameter.help: Date when scheduled task ends.

parameter.name: endtime
parameter.help: Time when scheduled task ends (seconds).

parameter.name: interval
parameter.help: Interval at which task is scheduled. * number of seconds (minimum is 60) * once * daily * weekly * monthly

parameter.name: requesttimeout
parameter.help: Can be used to extend the default timeout period.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Username, if URL is protected.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password, if URL is protected.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: Port number to use on the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: Password to provide to the proxy server.

parameter.name: resolveurl
parameter.help: Yes: resolve links in the output page to absolute references No: does not
